instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3660-03 Dim green light, no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Hi,

On an original AC I get just a dim green light, no voltage on PPBUS_G3H

~16.5V on both pin 4 + 5 of Q7010, ~0.2mV on drain

I've replaced Q7010 with same result.

Running off of bench power initially saw a quarter fan spin (Hasn't happened since) and only drawing 0.18A, also initially saw ~10V on the drain of Q7010 but slowly dropped and hasn't come back.

Not sure what other information would imediately help, any pointers appreciated.

threads.title: 820-3660-03 Dim green light, no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: 3662 board I assume? What is the history? On bench supply is PP3V42 present?

threads.title: 820-3660-03 Dim green light, no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Sorry for the confusion there, it certainly is a 3662
I wasn't getting anything on PP3V42 on bench power either.
It was left with me for issues not powering up, had liquid damage around the thunderbolt and USB port

Thanks

threads.title: 820-3660-03 Dim green light, no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: I'm at a loss on this one, hoping someone can help. Getting close to the deadline with this customer

threads.title: 820-3660-03 Dim green light, no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
D7005 has 2 inputs, why not just post voltage on all 3 pins....

Voltages on Q7010?

threads.title: 820-3660-03 Dim green light, no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Q7010 - 18.17V Pin 4, 18.46V Pin 5, 0V Pin 1 (Sorry, should have been 0.2mV in my original post, not 0.2V)
D7005 - 0V Pin 1, Pin 2, Pin 3

I'm assuming the cold temperature this morning could explain the small discrepancy from yesterdays readings

threads.title: 820-3660-03 Dim green light, no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: Starting to look like a bad D7010. Check voltages on both sides of R7011, the side that is connected to D7010 should have 6.8V.

threads.title: 820-3660-03 Dim green light, no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
18.2V on both sides of R7011, I'll look for a replacement zener for D7010, hopefully have a donor here.

Thanks Duke!

threads.title: 820-3660-03 Dim green light, no PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Haha, the day after and I see this video from Louis in my feed with the exact same issue... What are the odds lol
